data.title: Hancock County, GA Economy
data.meta_description: Best Places to Live | Compare cost of living, crime, cities, schools and more.
data.text:
Hancock County in Georgia is an attractive place to live for many reasons. It has a lower cost of living than the national average, with two bedroom rents being just $770 per month compared to $1,430 across the United States. The county also offers excellent grocery costs with an index of 92 versus 100 in the US. This makes it a great place to stretch your budget.

The job market in Hancock County offers a variety of opportunities. Local companies such as Hancock Bank, Hancock Gourmet Lobster Company, and Smart Care Equipment Solutions all provide employment opportunities. The county is also home to a number of government agencies that offer jobs for those seeking steady work. Education jobs are available at local schools like Hancock Central High School and Oconee Fall Line Technical College. Overall, Hancock County provides plenty of options for those looking for work in this area.

Hancock County has an unemployment rate of 6.4%. The US average is 6.0%.

Hancock County has seen the job market decrease by -2.6% over the last year. Future job growth over the next ten years is predicted to be 33.8%, which is higher than the US average of 33.5%.

Tax Rates for Hancock County

- The Sales Tax Rate for Hancock County is 8.0%. The US average is 7.3%.

- The Income Tax Rate for Hancock County is 6.0%. The US average is 4.6%.

- Tax Rates can have a big impact when Comparing Cost of Living.
